title: Calf Muscle Tear Case Study: A 35-Year-Old Male Athlete
clinical_history: A 35-year-old male athlete presented with a sudden onset of severe pain in his right calf muscle during a soccer game. He reported feeling a 'pop' in his calf as he was sprinting down the field. The patient has been experiencing difficulty walking and has limited mobility in his right ankle.
aggrevating_factors: Weight-bearing activities such as walking, running, and jumping; ankle dorsiflexion
picture: A 24-hour picture showing increased pain and stiffness in the morning, with gradual improvement throughout the day
past_history: Previous history of ankle sprains and calf strains, but nothing severe
medical_history: Generally healthy, with no significant medical conditions
medications: Ibuprofen as needed for pain management
personal_history: Active athlete, plays soccer recreationally 2-3 times a week
imaging: Ultrasound imaging revealed a grade 2 calf muscle tear
